00053 //The following defines indicate what items can be sold by the arms dealer
00054 #define           ARMS_DEALER_HANDGUNCLASS                  0x00000001
00055 #define           ARMS_DEALER_SMGCLASS                            0x00000002
00056 #define           ARMS_DEALER_RIFLECLASS                    0x00000004
00057 #define           ARMS_DEALER_MGCLASS                                   0x00000008
00058 #define           ARMS_DEALER_SHOTGUNCLASS                  0x00000010
00059 
00060 #define           ARMS_DEALER_KNIFECLASS                    0x00000020
00061 
00062 #define           ARMS_DEALER_BLADE                                     0x00000040
00063 #define           ARMS_DEALER_LAUNCHER                            0x00000080
00064 
00065 #define           ARMS_DEALER_ARMOUR                                    0x00000100
00066 #define           ARMS_DEALER_MEDKIT                                    0x00000200
00067 #define           ARMS_DEALER_MISC                                      0x00000400
00068 #define           ARMS_DEALER_AMMO                                      0x00000800
00069 
00070 #define           ARMS_DEALER_GRENADE                                   0x00001000
00071 #define           ARMS_DEALER_BOMB                                      0x00002000
00072 #define           ARMS_DEALER_EXPLOSV                                   0x00004000
00073 
00074 #define           ARMS_DEALER_KIT                                             0x00008000
00075

00097 #define           ARMS_DEALER_ONLY_USED_ITEMS         0x08000000
00098 #define           ARMS_DEALER_GIVES_CHANGE                  0x10000000        //The arms dealer will give the required change when doing a transaction
00099 #define           ARMS_DEALER_ACCEPTS_GIFTS                 0x20000000        //The arms dealer is the kind of person who will accept gifts
00100 #define           ARMS_DEALER_SOME_USED_ITEMS         0x40000000        //The arms dealer can have used items in his inventory
00101 #define           ARMS_DEALER_HAS_NO_INVENTORY  0x80000000        //The arms dealer does not carry any inventory

00115 //
00116 // Specific Dealer Flags
00117 // NOTE: Each dealer has 8 flags, but different dealers can and SHOULD share the same flag #s!
00118 //
00119 
00120 // Alex Fredo
00121 #define     ARMS_DEALER_FLAG__FREDO_HAS_SAID_ROCKET_RIFLE_QUOTE                     0x00000001  // Alex Fredo has already repaired the Rocket Rifle
00122 // Franz Hinkle
00123 #define     ARMS_DEALER_FLAG__FRANZ_HAS_SOLD_VIDEO_CAMERA_TO_PLAYER           0x00000001  // Franz Hinkle has sold the video camera to the player
00124 
00125 
00126 // THIS STRUCTURE HAS UNCHANGING INFO THAT DOESN'T GET SAVED/RESTORED/RESET
00127 typedef struct
00128 {
00129       union
00130       {
00131             struct
00132             {
00133                   FLOAT       dBuyModifier;                       // The price modifier used when this dealer is BUYING something.
00134                   FLOAT       dSellModifier;                // The price modifier used when this dealer is SELLING something.
00135             };
00136             struct
00137             {
00138                   FLOAT       dRepairSpeed;                       // Modifier to the speed at which a repairman repairs things
00139                   FLOAT       dRepairCost;                        // Modifier to the price a repairman charges for repairs
00140             };
00141       };
00142 
00143       UINT8       ubShopKeeperID;                           // Merc Id for the dealer
00144       UINT8       ubTypeOfArmsDealer;                 // Whether he buys/sells, sells, buys, or repairs
00145       INT32       iInitialCash;                                   // How much cash dealer starts with (we now reset to this amount once / day)
00146       UINT32      uiFlags;                                              // various flags which control the dealer's operations
00147 } ARMS_DEALER_INFO;
00148 
00149 
00150 // THIS STRUCTURE GETS SAVED/RESTORED/RESET
00151 typedef struct
00152 {
00153       UINT32      uiArmsDealersCash;                  // How much money the arms dealer currently has
00154 
00155       UINT8       ubSpecificDealerFlags;  // Misc state flags for specific dealers
00156       BOOLEAN fOutOfBusiness;                         // Set when a dealer has been killed, etc.
00157       BOOLEAN fRepairDelayBeenUsed;       // Set when a repairman has missed his repair time estimate & given his excuse for it
00158       BOOLEAN     fUnusedKnowsPlayer;                 // Set if the shopkeeper has met with the player before [UNUSED]
00159 
00160       UINT32      uiTimePlayerLastInSKI;  // game time (in total world minutes) when player last talked to this dealer in SKI
00161 
00162       UINT8       ubPadding[ 8 ];
00163 
00164 } ARMS_DEALER_STATUS;
00165 
00166 
00167 
00168 typedef struct
00169 {
00170       UINT16      usAttachment[MAX_ATTACHMENTS];            // item index of any attachments on the item
00171 
00172       INT8        bItemCondition;                     // if 0, no item is stored
00173                                                                                                 // from 1 to 100 indicates an item with that status
00174                                                                                                 // -1 to -100 means the item is in for repairs, flip sign for the actual status
00175 
00176       UINT8       ubImprintID;                              // imprint ID for imprinted items (during repair!)
00177 
00178       INT8        bAttachmentStatus[MAX_ATTACHMENTS]; // status of any attachments on the item
00179 
00180       UINT8       ubPadding[2];                             // filler
00181 
00182 } SPECIAL_ITEM_INFO;
00183 
00184 
00185 typedef struct
00186 {
00187       // Individual "special" items are stored here as needed, *one* per slot
00188       // An item is special if it is used (status < 100), has been imprinted, or has a permanent attachment
00189 
00190       SPECIAL_ITEM_INFO Info;
00191 
00192       UINT32  uiRepairDoneTime;                 // If the item is in for repairs, this holds the time when it will be repaired (in min)
00193 
00194       BOOLEAN fActive;                                      // TRUE means an item is stored here (empty elements may not always be freed immediately)
00195 
00196       UINT8       ubOwnerProfileId;             // stores which merc previously owned an item being repaired
00197 
00198       UINT8       ubPadding[6];                             // filler
00199 
00200 } DEALER_SPECIAL_ITEM;
00201 
00202 
00203 
00204 typedef struct
00205 {
00206       // Non-special items are all the identical and are totaled inside ubPerfectItems.
00207       // Items being repaired are also stored here, with a negative condition.
00208       // NOTE: special item elements may remain allocated long after item has been removed, to reduce memory fragmentation!!!
00209 
00210       UINT8       ubTotalItems;                             // sum of all the items (all perfect ones + all special ones)
00211       UINT8       ubPerfectItems;                     // non-special (perfect) items held by dealer
00212       UINT8       ubStrayAmmo;                              // partially-depleted ammo mags are stored here as #bullets, and can be converted to full packs
00213 
00214       UINT8       ubElementsAlloced;            // number of DEALER_SPECIAL_ITEM array elements alloced for the special item array
00215       DEALER_SPECIAL_ITEM *SpecialItem;   // dynamic array of special items with this same item index
00216 
00217       UINT32  uiOrderArrivalTime;         // Day the items ordered will arrive on.  It's UINT32 in case we change this to minutes.
00218       UINT8       ubQtyOnOrder;                             // The number of items currently on order
00219       BOOLEAN     fPreviouslyEligible;    // whether or not dealer has been eligible to sell this item in days prior to today
00220 
00221       UINT8       ubPadding[2];                             // filler
00222 
00223 } DEALER_ITEM_HEADER;
